fields_of_interest: Economy, finance and the euro, Agriculture, Budget, Trade, Competition, Consumers, Culture, International co-operation and development, Customs, Education and training, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Business and Industry, Environment, Taxation, Single market, Maritime affairs and fisheries, Research and innovation, External Relations, Trans-European Networks, Communication, Banking and financial services
head_office_address: EUBG c/o ESBC Kilwa House, 369 Toure Drive
eu_initiatives: We do not work with EU institutions - we work with the Government of Tanzania. We liaise and work with the EU delegation to Tanzania on a variety of issues and projects such as policy papers, workshops and dialogue.
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
commission_expert_groups_and_other_simil: The European Business Organisations Worldwide Network #E01267#http://ec.europa.eu/transparency/regexpert/index.cfm?do=groupDetail.groupDetail&groupID=1267#Member#C
goals__remit: The European Union Business Group was formed in early 2015 and is a strategic partner for improving Tanzania's business climate and promoting trade and investment between the two parties. The EUBG aspires to be a frank and reliable partner to engage with the Government but also the Tanzanian private sector on all issues of interest for European investors and overall to promote business environment as a key factor for the social and economic development of Tanzania.
relevant_communication: We do not work with EU institutions - we work with the Government of Tanzania. We liaise and work with the EU delegation to Tanzania on a variety of issues and projects such as policy papers, workshops and dialogue.
